titleStmt.title: Richardo Martino Hugo Hollandius Optimo Oratori Pessimus Poëta, veteris & perfecti amoris ergò nouum sed imperfectum poëma mittit. Sonulus Hendecasyllabius.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Richardo Martino Hugo Hollandius Optimo Oratori Pessimus Poëta, veteris & perfecti amoris ergò nouum sed imperfectum poëma mittit. Sonulus Hendecasyllabius.

monogr.title: Pancharis : the first booke. Containing the preparation of the loue betweene Ovven Tudyr, and the Queene, long since intended to her maiden Maiestie: and now dedicated to the inuincible Iames, second and greater Monarch of great Britaine, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, with the islands adiacent
monogr.author: Holland, Hugh

div.head: Richardo Martino Hugo Hollandius Optimo Oratori Pessimus Poëta, veteris & perfecti amoris ergò nouum sed imperfectum poëma mittit. Sonulus Hendecasyllabi • us.

lg.l: Nec doctum satis id, nimisue ineptum:
Vester Pegasus est, nec opse talis
Qui t antis vehar incitatus alis.
Verùm me videor sat esse adeptum,
Si carmen tibi tale sit receptum:
Nec lectum tibi non fuisse malis.
Quod (si quid saperem) domo quiet â
O sed famâ ego gloria{que} spretâ
